The ‘scientific method’ [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_scientific_method]is one of many different ways of learning about the universe around us (and the universe inside of each of us) and contains the following basic steps:

‘Wisdom’ is currently viewed as the fourth stage in a DIKW [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIKW]-based approach to the scientific-learning process.
 
‘Wisdom’ is currently viewed as the fourth stage in a DIKW [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DIKW]-based approach to the scientific-learning process.
−
• The first stage starts with the infinite facts of the universe around us (and the universe inside of each of us): Fortunately, most of these facts are functionally silent. This stage is termed ‘Scientific- Data’.
+
1. The first stage starts with the infinite facts of the universe around us (and the universe inside of each of us): Fortunately, most of these facts are functionally silent. This stage is termed ‘Scientific- Data’.
−
• The second stage is a specific grouping of data that places a demand upon the attention of the observer: This stage is termed ‘Scientific-Information’. (Some experts define ‘scientific-information’ as ‘scientific-data in context’).
+
2. The second stage is a specific grouping of data that places a demand upon the attention of the observer: This stage is termed ‘Scientific-Information’. (Some experts define ‘scientific-information’ as ‘scientific-data in context’).
−
• The third stage is a specific grouping of information that allows the observer to predict responses: This stage is termed ‘Scientific-Knowledge’. (Some experts define ‘scientific-knowledge’ as ‘scientific-information in context’).
+
3. The third stage is a specific grouping of information that allows the observer to predict responses: This stage is termed ‘Scientific-Knowledge’. (Some experts define ‘scientific-knowledge’ as ‘scientific-information in context’).
−
• The fourth stage in this distillation process is a specific grouping of scientific-knowledge, known as ‘Scientific-Wisdom’. The exact definition of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’ is somewhat difficult to describe precisely: Certainly, whereas ‘scientific-wisdom’ could be viewed as ‘scientific-knowledge in context’, this definition does not convey the operational sense of the term.
+
4. The fourth stage in this distillation process is a specific grouping of scientific-knowledge, known as ‘Scientific-Wisdom’. The exact definition of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’ is somewhat difficult to describe precisely: Certainly, whereas ‘scientific-wisdom’ could be viewed as ‘scientific-knowledge in context’, this definition does not convey the operational sense of the term.
−
o Perhaps Jonas Salk [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonas_Salk], the pioneering 20th Century scientist who is credited for discovering the first cure for poliomyelitis, has performed the most elegant recent studies of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’.
+
o Perhaps Jonas Salk [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonas_Salk], the pioneering 20th Century scientist who is credited for discovering the first cure for poliomyelitis, has performed the most elegant recent studies of ‘Scientific-Wisdom’. In brief, Salk (and now many others) view ‘Scientific-Wisdom’ as possessing 5 basic components:
